definitions: To cast off or lose (leaves, skin, hair, etc.) by natural process.
To get rid of something undesirable.
To emit or give off (light, tears, blood, etc.).
To cause (water) to run off without penetrating.
examples: Trees shed their leaves in autumn.
The company shed jobs to cut costs.
She shed a few tears during the sad movie.
The duck's feathers shed water easily.
